head.title: World News Briefs;Hospitalized Greek Chief Is Back on Respirator

identified-content.person: PAPANDREOU, ANDREAS (PRIME MIN) ANDREAS GEORGE PAPANDREOU
identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Government, Philanthropy and NGO

hedline.hl1: World News Briefs;Hospitalized Greek Chief Is Back on Respirator

block.p: Doctors put Prime Minister Andreas Papandreou back on a respirator today as his health worsened, and they said they feared that an infection threatened his weakened body.

The 76-year-old Prime Minister has been in intensive care for a month after being hospitalized with pneumonia. Most of the time, he has been on a respirator and kidney machine, but in the last few days he had been breathing on his own.
Doctors put Prime Minister Andreas Papandreou back on a respirator today as his health worsened, and they said they feared that an infection threatened his weakened body.

The 76-year-old Prime Minister has been in intensive care for a month after being hospitalized with pneumonia. Most of the time, he has been on a respirator and kidney machine, but in the last few days he had been breathing on his own.
In the last 12 hours, the Prime Minister's condition worsened," the Onassis Cardiac Surgery Center said. "His breathing is being supported by a respirator continually."
Laboratory tests had not yet confirmed doctors' suspicions that Mr. Papandreou was suffering from a new infection.
